page.title: 12THE RIVER WYLYE
page.content:
My Dad is a River Keeper on the River Wylye.In the winter he cuts out the weeds and pulls out mud banks to make a gravel bed for the brown trout to spawn. In the spring he puts in brown trout which have been reared in big tanks. He also cuts the water weeds in the spring to make the river flow easier and for better fishing and river life.
His length of river runs from Jobs Mill to Heytesbury railway bridge.This is set into 'beats'. In the beat downstream of Bishopstrow there are brown trout, rainbow grayling and a few roach. In the upper beats there are brown trout and a few rainbow graylings. Other living things in the river are cray-fish, water shrimps which give the trout pink flesh, clams,mussels and eels.
